title: Requires that judges receive proper certificates of authorization or be enrolled members of the party for which they are running in the primary election
summary: Requires that judges be enrolled members of the party for which they are running in the primary election or to have received a proper certificate of authorization filed properly according to the election law.

       AN ACT to amend the election law, in relation to requiring judges to  be

         ing to the election law

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subdivision 4 of section 6-120  of  the  election  law,  as
    2  amended  by chapter 373 of the laws of 1978, is amended and a new subdi-
    3  vision 5 is added to read as follows:
    4    4. This section shall not apply to a political  party  designating  or

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S1562

TITLE OF BILL:

An act
to amend the election law, in relation to requiring judges to be
enrolled members of the party for a primary election
or to have received a proper certificate of authorization filed properly
according to the election law

PURPOSE:

This bill ends the exemption applicable to candidates for judicial
office from the requirement that in order to run on a party line in a
primary election they must be a member of the political party, or
obtain a certificate authorizing them to run on its party line from
the members of such party's committee representing the political
subdivision of the office sought.

SUMMARY OF PROVISIONS:

Section 1: Amends Election Law section 6-120 subdivision 4 to
eliminate the exemption for judicial candidates from the requirements
of subdivisions 1-3 that in order to petition or run as a candidate
of a party membership the candidate must be a member of that party or
be designated or nominated by a majority of the party committee for
the applicable subdivision. It also creates a new subdivision 5,
which specifically provides that such requirements apply to any
candidate for judicial office in any election where other individuals
can challenge the nomination in a primary election.

Section 2: Provides that the Act takes effect immediately.

EXISTING LAW:

The current law provides an exemption from party membership or party
committee nomination for candidates for judicial office as described
above.

JUSTIFICATION:

Under current law, the exemption from the party membership or
nomination law applicable to candidates for all other offices has
resulted in abuses and a free-for-all in judicial primaries that
confuses the primary electorate. And, the exemption lacks a rational
basis for judicial candidates to be treated differently from
candidates for other public offices in regard to the rules pertaining
to party enrollment.

LEGISLATIVE HISTORY:

A.3126 of 2009
A.1515A of 2007-2008
A.63 of 2005-2006
A.8722 of 2003-2004

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:

None.

LOCAL FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:

None.

EFFECTIVE DATE:

This bill is effective immediately.
